sense.name: the act of grasping into one's arms
sense.examples: They had one long last embrace before he boarded the train. The wrestlers were locked in an embrace on the mat.

sense.name: a state of being encircled
sense.examples: It's a lovely coral island in the embrace of the sea. The rodent was in the deadly embrace of the boa constrictor. It was the first former Soviet satellite to free itself from the Moscow's embrace.

sense.name: enthusiastic acceptance or endorsement
sense.examples: His eager embrace of new ideas is an appealing quality. The public's embrace of the government's policy was short-lived.
